creator: chip@force-elite.com
text:
apr_atomic_* defines are broken in FreeBSD.

The FreeBSD Ports have been patching for this for a long time.

The available patch should be applied.

Created attachment 10292
Redefine Atomics on FreeBSD.
creator: chip@force-elite.com
jorton@redhat.com
text:
This was fixed on HEAD a while back: I thought when I looked into it actually
that there was an architecture where the FreeBSD atomic.h was a kernel header
and not usable from userspace, but I can't remember which...

Is it true that atomic.h is always usable from userspace?

creator: jorton@redhat.com
text: *** Bug 26940 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

creator: chip@force-elite.com
text:
/usr/include/machine/atomic.h is always visible from userspace on FreeBSD 5.x.

I don't have access to a 4.x box to know if this is true for all modern versions
of FreeBSD.

This patch does seem to fix the build for both FreeBSD 4.x and 5.x, and the
Ports system has been using it for a long time without any special cases for
either version, so i assume it is perfectly fine.

creator: chip@force-elite.com
text:
As far as supported platforms atomic.h is available on alpha, amd64, i386, ia64,
powerpc and sparc64.  This includes all of FreeBSD's Tier 1 and Tier 2 platforms.  

The only unsupported platform is S/390, and that is classed as Tier 3, and I
honestly don't know of any modern development with it.
So, can anyone knock this off for 0.9.X?
creator: chip@force-elite.com
jorton@redhat.com
text: Committed for the next release, thanks again for the patch.
